title: I love reading but I am not really good at writing. Should I take AP Language and Composition? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would. If your reading comprehension is high, the bar for writing on AP Lang is low enough that it's reasonable that you could at least pass or even get a 4 or a 5. They're really looking for organization of thoughts in the essay — content is only marginally important if that. Same with the SAT/ACT essay. The emphasis is usually flipped in an introductory English college course where writing essays is the main point of interest. I’d see if I could skip English writing courses at all costs in college. As a Philosophy major they would've driven me up the wall, and I like writing. I got a 5 in AP Lang and a 4 in AP Lit, and never had to take an English course in college. Thank god. I had other projects to focus on. My best friend, an engineer, comes to mind. Sometimes her writing is hilariously bad. She hated her technical writing course (yes, the one made for engineers) with a passion, but she also didn't try terribly much. Point being — the course was annoying to juggle with her lab work.
I was in the same boat as you are. I decided not to take AP Lang, but I am going to take AP Literature.
